poem.title: Deep Harbour (Djupviken)
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: A spray of figs on shore, she fills Her strips of cotton sail (no frigs, no frills) And beams at this, my face like fizz. Shin-deep in shingle frizz, she flings A stick. The hounds of the gale dive in, With canine fids to try the knots of Cold or courage in me: Honoured fibs and firms dissolve In flimsy bubbles. Hope, like her And Finland, grows on granite.
